meanings.definition: The top of a ship's mast.
meanings.sent1: The masthead swayed gently in the breeze.
meanings.sent2: The sailor climbed to the masthead to get a better view of the sea.
meanings.sent3: The seagull perched on the masthead, pretending to be the captain of the ship.
meanings.sent4: As the storm approached, the masthead stood tall like a guardian protecting the vessel.
meanings.sent5: The bright red flag fluttered proudly from the masthead, signaling the ship's nationality.

meanings.definition: The title of a newspaper or magazine displayed at the top of the front page.
meanings.sent1: The masthead of the newspaper featured bold letters announcing the latest headlines.
meanings.sent2: Readers often glance at the masthead to quickly identify the publication.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat knocked over the newspaper, causing the masthead to be hidden under the couch.
meanings.sent4: The masthead of the magazine shone brightly, drawing attention to the featured articles.
meanings.sent5: The masthead of the newspaper was elegantly designed, reflecting the publication's prestige.

meanings.definition: A list of the key personnel of a publication.
meanings.sent1: The masthead listed the editor-in-chief, reporters, and photographers of the magazine.
meanings.sent2: New employees eagerly searched the masthead to find their names among the staff.
meanings.sent3: The prankster secretly added their name to the masthead, causing confusion among the team.
meanings.sent4: The masthead revealed the talented individuals behind the successful publication.
meanings.sent5: The masthead proudly displayed the diverse team responsible for the magazine's content.
